page.title: 18THE CHURCHES
page.content: The Anglican Churches of St. Mary's, Bishopsbourne, and St. Giles, Kingston are both architecturally noteworthy. The Rev. Richard Hooker, author of "The Laws of Ecclesiastical Polity", was Vicar of St.Mary's from 1595-1600. "Hooker's Hedge", a 15ft. yew hedge, still exists today. Because of the decline in church attendance and lack of finance, both parishes share an in- cumbent with Barham. This means that there is rarely more than one service in each church on Sundays. There is a choir at both churches and a Sunday School at Kingston. The Parochial Church Councils, comprising the Rector two Churchwardens and 10 elected lay members meet four times a year to deal with church affairs. Members of both congregations help with the cleaning and upkeep, and organise fund-raising events to provide extra vital income.
